(1990) , the titres being expressed as plaque-forming units (PFU). For viral assay of brain and spinal cord (see below), 10% (w/v) homogenates were prepared in Eagle's minimum essential medium, and the supernates were subjected to the plaque method after centrifugation at 2000 rpm (1000 g) at 4°C for 10 min.

In a group of experiments designed to examine the effects of age and route of inoculation on susceptibility of rats to infection, rats (n =400) aged 1, 2, 4 or 8 weeks were inoculated by the i.c., i.n., i.v., i.p., s.c. or oral routes with various doses. The dose volume was 0·02 ml for i.c. and i.n. received a volume of only 0·02 ml. As control, several rats were given non-infected fluid from SK-K cell cultures in each individual experiment.

The experimental design and results in rats aged 1, 4 and 8 weeks are shown in Table 1 . In animals that survived until the experiment was terminated (14 days), no virus was detected in the brain by tissue culture or IHC. Control rats remained normal throughout.

Animals aged 1 week given doses ranging from 2×10 3 to 2×10 6 PFU by all routes except the oral died. (The i.v. route was not tested in rats of this age.) Doses ranging from 2 to 2×10 2 PFU usually resulted in death in the majority of animals inoculated. By the oral route, however, even 2×10 5 PFU produced only two deaths in five rats, and 2×10 4 PFU produced none. All deaths occurred within 3 to 7 days of inoculation.

The results in 2-week-old rats (not shown in Table 1 ) were generally similar to those described above. Doses of 2×10 3 PFU by the i.v. route killed three of five rats, but i.v. doses of 200 PFU were without effect. No deaths occurred in rats given 2×10 6 PFU by the oral route.

Rats aged 4 weeks appeared somewhat less susceptible. For example, doses of 2×10 3 PFU or less by the i.n., i.p., s.c. or i.v. route killed only a minority of animals. Moreover, the time to death ranged from 4 to 12 days. Thus, doses as large as 2×10 6 PFU by the i.p. and i.v. routes were without apparent effect, and doses of 2×10 4 PFU by the i.n. and s.c. routes killed only a proportion of rats.
